text: William H. "Bill" Sumix (February 11, 1912 – February 27, 1978), often misnamed "Bill Summers" in sports publications, was an American professional basketball player. He played in the National Basketball League for the Hammond Ciesar All-Americans in one game during the 1940–41 season and scored two points. == References == Category:1912 births Category:1978 deaths Category:American men's basketball players Category:Basketball players from Ohio Category:Guards (basketball) Category:Hammond Ciesar All-Americans players Category:Sportspeople from Akron, Ohio Category:Sportspeople from Montgomery County, Pennsylvania
title: Bill Sumerix
